patients.description: sepsis or septic shock in the Emergency Department. Hypotension or serum lactate 4 mmol/L or more after 20 to 30 ml per kilogram of body weight over 30 minutes
patients.bullet: Time between hospital arrival and randomization: 55 minutes (median)

study.intervention: Early goal-directed therapy Blood transfusion: 64% Antibiotic administration: 86% over six hours Fluid replacement: 4981 mL over 6 hours (may include pre-randomization)
study.comparison: Usual care Blood transfusion: 19% Antibiotic administration: 92% over six hours Fluid replacement: 3499 mL over 6 hours (may include pre-randomization)

study.citation: Early Goal-Directed Therapy Collaborative Group of Zhejiang Province
study.intervention: Early goal-directed therapy Blood transfusion: details not reported Antibiotic administration: details not reported Fluid replacement: details not reported
study.comparison: Usual care Blood transfusion: details not reported Antibiotic administration: details not reported Fluid replacement: details not reported

patients.description: hypotension or serum lactate 4 mmol/L or more after 1000 mL intravenous fluids over 30 minutes in the Emergency Department
patients.bullet: Time between hospital arrival and randomization: 197 minutes (mean or median not specified)

study.intervention: Early goal-directed therapy Blood transfusion: 14% Antibiotic administration: 98% by six hours Fluid replacement: 2805 mL over 6 hours Central venous catheterization: 94% (within 6 hours)
study.comparison: Usual care Blood transfusion: 8% Antibiotic administration: 97% by six hours Fluid replacement: 3285 mL over 6 hours Central venous catheterization: 58% (within 6 hours)

patients.description: hypotension or serum lactate 4 mmol/L or more after 1000 mL intravenous fluids over 60 minutes and intravenous antibiotics in the Emergency Department
patients.bullet: Time between hospital arrival and randomization (includes receiving antbiotics): 168 minutes (median)

study.intervention: Early goal-directed therapy Blood transfusion: 13.6% Antibiotic administration: 100% by 2.8 hrs Fluid replacement: 1964 mL over six hours Central venous catheterization: 90% (within 6 hours)
study.comparison: Usual care Blood transfusion: 7% Antibiotic administration: 100% by 2.7 hrs Fluid replacement: 1713 mL over six hours Central venous catheterization: 62% (within 6 hours)

outcome.bullet: Mortality in hospital (used in current meta-analysis)
